briefdescription.para: Appends the contents of the given file to the string, returning error code.

detaileddescription.para: At the moment, won't open a file more than a megabyte in size.

memberdef.argsstring: (const DBusString *str, const DBusString *filename, dbus_bool_t world_readable, DBusError *error)
memberdef.name: _dbus_string_save_to_file

briefdescription.para: Writes a string out to a file.

detaileddescription.para: If the file exists, it will be atomically overwritten by the new data.

str
the string to write out
filename
the file to save string to
world_readable
If set, ensure the file is world readable
error
error to be filled in on failure
FALSE on failure If the file exists, it will be atomically overwritten by the new data.

parameterdescription.para: the file to save string to
if true, ensure file is world readable
error to be filled in on failure

briefdescription.para: Makes the file readable by every user in the system.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the file's permissions could be changed.

briefdescription.para: Creates the given file, failing if the file already exists.

simplesect.para: TRUE if we created the file and it didn't exist
